page.title: 07THE DAY OF A JUNIOR CHILD.
page.content: I am 9 years old. I go to Ryton Juniors. I come to school by car. The whistle goes and we go into lines. Each class contains 25 or 28 people. We have register. On Mondays we go straight to the baths. After assembly we usually have maths. We have Scottish Maths. Breaktime is 10.40. We play marbles and adventure games. After break we have English. Sometimes we do dictionary exercises. At 12.00 we have dinner. We have a choice - turkey curry, chips and rice with chocolate cake for pudding. After lunch we do R.E. and art or history and geography. Sometimes we use the computer for serious things. We have our break at 2.30, then sometimes we have P.E. We put our trays away and say "Goodnight". On the way home I watch marbles and fights.
